chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Michael C Schmidt was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 3:57pm. 
Defendant Michael C Schmidt in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Holly Higgins from WCS is present in court.  Troy Hansen from Abilities is present in court.
Both ADA Beck and Attorney Svehlek indicate that they are in agreement with the proposed Conditional Release Plan.
Mr. Schmidt makes a statement that he is in agreement with the proposed Plan and he feels much more ready to comply with its provisions.
Both parties waive their right to present additional evidence on the Plan.
The Court approves the Conditional Release Plan. 
Ms. Higgins indicates that Mr. Schmidt has already signed his Rules of Probation.
The Court requires Mr. Schmidt to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 12:00 Noon tomorrow.  
The Court indicates to the JCSO Deputy that Mr. Schmidt may be released to Mr. Hansen from Abilities. 
recess 4:02pm.

[MK] case called at 2:34pm. 
Defendant Michael C Schmidt appears via videoconferencing from MMHI.  His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek, appears in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
While the videoconferencing system is operational, there is currently an issue that the camera that captures the view of the Courtroom Bench is not in focus.  The Court verifies with Mr. Schmidt that he can hear and see the proceedings; the view of counsel is clear, but the view of the Court is blurred.  Both Mr. Schmidt and Attorney Svehlek agree to proceed with today's hearing with the camera-focus issue as is.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient for purposes of today's hearing. 
After review of the psychiatrist's report and on agreement of the parties, the Court finds that Mr. Schmidt is appropriate for Conditional Release. The Court requires the preparation of a Conditional Release Plan and the approval of such a plan before Mr. Schmidt is released.  The Plan-report is to be filed within the next sixty days.
recess 2:40pm.

Defendant Michael C Schmidt appears via videoconferencing from MMHI. His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek, is in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
[Holly Higgins from WCS is present.]
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek indicates that while the Defense does not contest the incidents that are listed in the document, the Defense asks that it be allowed to argue that Mr. Schmidt not be revoked, and instead the Defense would argue that a different resolution could be granted.

[MK] case called at 8:47am. 
Defendant Michael C Schmidt in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Holly Higgins from WCS-Forensic Services Unit is present. 
ADA Hall indicates that the State's position is that it is not capable of overcoming the recommendation by Dr. Freiburger that Mr. Schmidt be allowed conditional release, though the State has some concerns related to the contents of the hospital report.  
Attorney Svehlek argues in support of the proposed Conditional Release Plan, indicating that the plan is that Mr. Schmidt will be transfered to a group home for a period of about two weeks, and then he will be transitioned to independent living; the medication order will remain in effect. 
The Court makes inquiries of Ms. Higgins about the intended placement. 
Mr. Schmidt makes a statement. 

The Court approves and adopts Conditional Release Plan, adding the requirements:
--Mr. Schmidt will not be allowed to reside in an unsupervised setting without two-weeks prior notice to the Court
--While Mr. Schmidt is in a supervised living setting, any off-grounds activities will be supervised;  an exception is this is that the supervisors are authorized to have Mr. Schmidt travel directly to and from  and attend daily church without a supervisor 
--While Mr. Schmidt lives in a supervised living setting, he will be under a curfew whenever the facility is not staffed with supervisors.  Mr. Schmidt needs to be on the grounds when supervisors are not at the facility. 
  
As to these added requirements, the Court indicates that if the treatment team believes that it would be appropriate to discontinue one of these added requirements, they are to submit a letter at least two weeks in advance of any intended modification, with a copy to both attorneys.  The Court may or may not then schedule those for hearing. 
recess 9:17am.

records.addlTxt: Huber/Work Release Notification
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF320 and 14CT240 called at 1:44pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Michael C Schmidt in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.

Case 14CF320 - 
GUILTY AND NGI plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  
State informs the Court that victim rights compliance has not yet been complied with. 
Procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel.  
Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.

Case 14CT240 - 
GUILTY plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.

Recommendations presented by Counsel.
New mailing address information provided for the defendant.  The defendant is currently physically residing at the Mile-Away Motel in Fort Atkinson, but mail is not accepted there. 
The Court orders:

14CF320 -
The Court orders:
- Conditional Release for 3 years with a plan to be developed by the Department of Corrections, through WCS.
- Costs - $268 - to be entered as a civil judgment.
- DNA surcharge - $250 - to be entered as a civil judgment. 
Order of Commitment and Order for Conditional Release Plan endorsed by the Court. 

14CT240 - 
The Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 1 year with conditions.  The defendant has no credit for time served. 
CONDITIONS:
-  5 days jail with work release for purposes of counseling, therapy or any other type of treatment commencing 2/4/15 by 7pm.   The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.
-  AODA and follow through
-  Any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapies per the Agent. 
-  Absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlles substances without a valid prescription.  
-  Take all prescription drugs as prescribed. 
-  Random drug screens
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval. 

The Court also orders:
-  $1242 ($400 fine with costs/fees/surcharges) - to be entered as a civil judgment. 
-  $200 DNA surcharge - to be entered as a civil judgment. 
-  $56.74 blood testing costs - to be entered as a civil judgmen in favor of Lake Mills Police Department. 
-  AODA
-  VIP attendance
-  14 month d.l. revocation
-  14 month IID 
-  6pts assessed. 

Case 14CF320 continued for Conditional Release Hearing on 3/3/15 at 2:30pm.  Counsel to be prepared to address sentence credit and restitution at that date and time also.

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
Conditional Release Hearing on 3/3/15 at 2:30pm.  Counsel to be prepared to address sentence credit and restitution at that date and time also.

Case called at 1:21 pm
Judge Weston presiding for Branch 3
Defendant Michael C Schmidt in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek provides updated address for the defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Not to drive a motor vehicle
-No contact, direct or direct with Mark Tanguay
-No presence at the residence of Mark Tanguay 1009 S. Main St. Fort Atkinson
-Comply with all mental health treament and corporate with his case manager at Human Services
-Take all medications as prescribed by the treating physician
-Comply with a curfew, to be present in his own home from 9:00 pm to 7:00 am everyday

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 9/26/14 at 8:30 am
